verses.roman:
ye hao, se hao tumi, tomāke namaskāra
prabhu tāre prema diyā kaila puraskāra

synonyms: ye hao—whatever You are; se hao tumi—whatever You may be; tomāke—unto You; namaskāra—my obeisances; prabhu—the Lord; tāre—unto him; prema—love of Godhead; diyā—delivered; kaila—did; puraskāra—honor.
translation: The all-knowing astrologer concluded, "Whatever You may be or whoever You may be, I offer my respectful obeisances unto You!" By His causeless mercy, the Lord then gave him love of Godhead, thus rewarding him for his service.

purport.content: The incident of Lord Caitanya's meeting the all-knowing astrologer is not mentioned in the Caitanya-bhāgavata, but we cannot therefore say that it did not take place. On the contrary, we must accept the statement of Kṛṣṇadāsa Kavirāja Gosvāmī that whatever the Caitanya-bhāgavata did not mention he has especially mentioned in Caitanya-caritāmṛta.
